Ensure all skills implement search() method for universal search
description:
The universal search functionality exists in core (src/glorious_agents/core/search.py and cli.py), but needs all skills to implement the search() method.

**Current state:**
- ✅ Universal search command: `agent search` exists
- ✅ SearchResult protocol defined in core/search.py
- ✅ Most skills already have search() implemented:
  - ai, cache, code-atlas, feedback, issues, notes, planner, prompts, temporal, vacuum

**Required work:**
Audit all skills and ensure each has a search() method that:
- Returns list[SearchResult] 
- If search is not applicable for that skill, return []
- Otherwise return relevant results with proper scoring

**Skills to check:**
Run through all example-skills/* and verify each has search() or explicitly returns []

**Implementation:**
Each skill.py should have:
```python
def search(query: str, limit: int = 10) -> list[SearchResult]:
    # If not applicable: return []
    # Otherwise: return relevant SearchResult objects
```

Enhance 'issues show' to accept multiple issue IDs
description:
The `issues show` command should accept multiple issue IDs as arguments.

**Current behavior:**
Must chain multiple commands: `uv run agent issues show issue-5fd36a && uv run agent issues show issue-e7b502`

**Desired behavior:**
- Accept multiple issue IDs: `uv run agent issues show issue-5fd36a issue-e7b502 issue-49765f`
- When `--json` flag is given: return a mapping of issue-ids -> issue-data
- When `--json` is not given: print issues in sequence with separators

**Benefits:**
- More efficient - single command invocation
- Cleaner command chains
- Better JSON output structure for programmatic use

description:

- Simple tag/project filtering only

- Update search() method to use FTS5

**Benefits:**
- Fast search across queued tasks
- Better task discovery
- Consistent with issues FTS implementation

title: Comprehensive integration tests for all example skills
description: Create integration tests that validate ALL example skills work correctly according to AGENTIC_WORKFLOW.md. Tests should cover: skill loading, context initialization, database operations, event bus, search functionality, CLI commands, error handling, and inter-skill communication. Follow the workflow phases: Context Gathering, Planning, Execution, Feedback, and Knowledge Management.

title: Setup integration test infrastructure and fixtures
description: Create pytest fixtures for: isolated test database, skill loading, context setup, cleanup. Create base test class with common assertions. Setup test helpers for CLI invocation, event verification, and database inspection.

title: Integration tests: Context Gathering phase (atlas, search, notes)
description: Test atlas scan/rank/check/query, universal search across skills, notes add/search/list. Verify code indexing, search results accuracy, note tagging and retrieval.

title: Integration tests: Planning phase (issues, planner)
description: Test issues create/update/list/ready/dependencies/bulk operations. Test planner add/next/sync/update. Verify issue lifecycle, dependency resolution, priority sorting, and planner queue management.

title: Integration tests: Execution phase (cache, prompts, temporal)
description: Test cache set/get/prune/warmup with TTL. Test prompts register/render/list with variables. Test temporal filtering and parsing. Verify TTL expiration, template substitution, and time range queries.

title: Integration tests: Feedback phase (feedback, automations, ai)
description: Test feedback record/stats/list. Test automations create/trigger/list. Test ai embedding/query if available. Verify feedback learning, event-driven automation, and AI integration.

title: Integration tests: Knowledge Management phase (vacuum, migrate)
description: Test vacuum run/history for knowledge distillation. Test migrate export/import/backup. Verify data compaction, optimization, and migration integrity.

title: Integration tests: Cross-skill communication and workflows
description: Test end-to-end workflows: 1) Create issue -> Add to planner -> Update status -> Record feedback. 2) Atlas scan -> Create issues from violations -> Sync to planner. 3) Event bus pub/sub between skills. 4) Universal search across all skills. Verify inter-skill dependencies and event-driven behavior.
